wikipedia_page.main: William "Bill" 'Ernie' H. Hopper (birth registered fourth ¼ 1922 – September 2008) was a Welsh professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for Wales, and at club level for Warrington (Heritage No.), and Leeds, as a prop, i.e. number 8 or 10, during the era of contested scrums.

response: William Hopper (1915–1970) was an American actor.
* William Hopper (industrialist) (1816-1885), Scottish industrialist and sports proponent in Imperial Russia
* William Hopper (politician) (born 1929), British banker and politician
* William Hopper (1966–2017), Canadian author of The Heathen's Guide to World Religions and other works
